revised_title: The Influence of Geological Changes on the Earth's Axis of Rotation
tldr: The author investigates the effects of geological changes on the Earth's axis of rotation, focusing on the obliquity of the ecliptic and the precession of the equinoxes. The study explores the potential impact of these changes on the Earth's shape and the position of its poles, concluding that a single large geological change could cause an alteration in the position of the pole by up to three degrees of latitude.
